events.message: Customer reported a car collision involving their vehicle on Main Street causing moderate damage to the front bumper and hood.
The claim has been categorized under Auto Accident following review of the initial report and damage description.
An insurance agent has been assigned to handle the auto accident claim and to coordinate further proceedings.
Acknowledgment of the claim has been sent to the customer confirming receipt and commencement of the process.
Requested the customer to submit photos of the damaged vehicle and a copy of the police accident report for further evaluation.
Customer submitted all requested documents including detailed photos and a formal police report as proof of the accident.
Initiated investigation by contacting witnesses and assessing damage estimates through an assigned vehicle inspector.
Investigation concluded with confirmation that the accident was caused by another driver; damage assessment finalized.
A settlement amount was proposed to cover the full repair costs for the vehicle along with reimbursement for the rental car.
Customer expressed satisfaction with the proposed settlement and appreciated the prompt handling of the claim.
The claim was officially approved by the claims manager, authorizing disbursement of the settlement funds.
Payment for the agreed settlement amount was issued directly to the customerâ€™s bank account for vehicle repairs.
The auto accident claim case has been closed following payment and confirmation from the customer about repair scheduling.
Case files and all documentation related to the auto accident claim have been securely archived for future reference.
